subject: Fix merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument -n/--network-data: expected one argument
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-09 10:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/common/convert_nic_template.yaml'], 'message': "Fix merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument -n/--network-data: expected one argument

In change I50426d2cc296e237fa8a8cf6c750e760b0992dd2 we added:

  -n {{ network_data_file | default(default_network_data) }}

The problem is that network_data_file is a fact that is set to ''
whenever there is no -n in the overcloud deploy script. So all
FFUs that deployed without -n now are failing with:

/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/tools/merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py
-n  --tht-dir /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates --role-name $NIC_ROLE_NAME
--roles-data /home/stack/composable_roles/roles/roles_data.yaml --discard-comments yes
--template /home/stack/composable_roles/network/nic-configs//controller.yaml

merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument
-n/--network-data: expected one argument

This is because the empty string is not undefined, so we need to
add a second param to default() set to true:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_filters.html#providing-default-values

Change-Id: Id41ccf25eb96e4307eddb80ef82dbda98f347c0b
(cherry picked from commit 2766cfa91b9ec515c0eb78cea6cb7649fcf45397)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument -n/--network-data: expected one argument

In change I50426d2cc296e237fa8a8cf6c750e760b0992dd2 we added:

  -n {{ network_data_file | default(default_network_data) }}

The problem is that network_data_file is a fact that is set to ''
whenever there is no -n in the overcloud deploy script. So all
FFUs that deployed without -n now are failing with:

/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/tools/merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py
-n  --tht-dir /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates --role-name $NIC_ROLE_NAME
--roles-data /home/stack/composable_roles/roles/roles_data.yaml --discard-comments yes
--template /home/stack/composable_roles/network/nic-configs//controller.yaml

merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument
-n/--network-data: expected one argument

This is because the empty string is not undefined, so we need to
add a second param to default() set to true:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_filters.html#providing-default-values

Change-Id: Id41ccf25eb96e4307eddb80ef82dbda98f347c0b
(cherry picked from commit 2766cfa91b9ec515c0eb78cea6cb7649fcf45397)

commit_message:
Fix merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument -n/--network-data: expected one argument

In change I50426d2cc296e237fa8a8cf6c750e760b0992dd2 we added:

  -n {{ network_data_file | default(default_network_data) }}

The problem is that network_data_file is a fact that is set to ''
whenever there is no -n in the overcloud deploy script. So all
FFUs that deployed without -n now are failing with:

/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/tools/merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py
-n  --tht-dir /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates --role-name $NIC_ROLE_NAME
--roles-data /home/stack/composable_roles/roles/roles_data.yaml --discard-comments yes
--template /home/stack/composable_roles/network/nic-configs//controller.yaml

merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument
-n/--network-data: expected one argument

This is because the empty string is not undefined, so we need to
add a second param to default() set to true:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_filters.html#providing-default-values

Change-Id: Id41ccf25eb96e4307eddb80ef82dbda98f347c0b
(cherry picked from commit 2766cfa91b9ec515c0eb78cea6cb7649fcf45397)

commit_message:
Fix merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument -n/--network-data: expected one argument

In change I50426d2cc296e237fa8a8cf6c750e760b0992dd2 we added:

  -n {{ network_data_file | default(default_network_data) }}

The problem is that network_data_file is a fact that is set to ''
whenever there is no -n in the overcloud deploy script. So all
FFUs that deployed without -n now are failing with:

/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/tools/merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py
-n  --tht-dir /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates --role-name $NIC_ROLE_NAME
--roles-data /home/stack/composable_roles/roles/roles_data.yaml --discard-comments yes
--template /home/stack/composable_roles/network/nic-configs//controller.yaml

merge-new-params-nic-config-script.py: error: argument
-n/--network-data: expected one argument

This is because the empty string is not undefined, so we need to
add a second param to default() set to true:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_filters.html#providing-default-values

Change-Id: Id41ccf25eb96e4307eddb80ef82dbda98f347c0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 15:22:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "conf: Deprecate 'devname' field of '[pci] passthrough_whitelist'

This field has caused far too many issues, particularly when used with
VFs. Deprecate it entirely and encourage people to use values that
aren't as likely to change/not exist.

Change-Id: Ia9d3fc7f52ce55332ae392cd5a70269cc4f4bfcc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-07-18 15:55:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "conf: Deprecate 'devname' field of '[pci] passthrough_whitelist'

This field has caused far too many issues as seen in multiple public
downstream bugs [1][2][3]. Each of these have all been closed at least
once, if not multiple times, as WONTFIX, and there are many other bugs,
public and private and for varying versions.

The issues with this option are numerous. On older kernels, such as
Ubuntu 14.04, where the persistent devname changes still hadn't landed,
it was common for the name of a VF or PF to change after they were used
by a VM (e.g. eth3->eth10). Even with the predictable devnames present
in later kernels, some udev configurations may result in the kernel/udev
not bind the PF or VF back to a NIC driver and may instead elect to
leave them bound to 'vfio-pci', meaning the device won't have a netdev
for the device. This breaks the PCI resource tracker (this was the cause
of [1]). Finally, while the rest of the fields work with all types of
PCI devices, the 'devname' field only works with NICs.

While we've already been advising people to not use this for quite some
time (at least downstream), people just keep shooting themselves in the
foot. Its deprecation is long overdue, in order to prod and eventually
force people to use one of the far more reliable alternatives, so do
just that.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1589796
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1590716
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1593290

Change-Id: Ia9d3fc7f52ce55332ae392cd5a70269cc4f4bfcc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

once, if not multiple times, as WONTFIX, and there are many other bugs,
public and private and for varying versions.

The issues with this option are numerous. On older kernels, such as
Ubuntu 14.04, where the persistent devname changes still hadn't landed,
it was common for the name of a VF or PF to change after they were used
by a VM (e.g. eth3->eth10). Even with the predictable devnames present
in later kernels, some udev configurations may result in the kernel/udev
not binding the PF or VF back to a NIC driver and may instead elect to
leave them bound to 'vfio-pci', meaning the device won't have a netdev
for the device. This breaks the PCI resource tracker (this was the cause
of [1]). Finally, while the rest of the fields work with all types of
PCI devices, the 'devname' field only works with NICs.

time (at least downstream), people just keep shooting themselves in the
foot. Its deprecation is long overdue, in order to prod and eventually
force people to use one of the far more reliable alternatives, so do
just that.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1589796
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1590716
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1593290

commit_message:
conf: Deprecate 'devname' field of '[pci] passthrough_whitelist'

This field has caused far too many issues as seen in multiple public
downstream bugs [1][2][3]. Each of these have all been closed at least
once, if not multiple times, as WONTFIX, and there are many other bugs,
public and private and for varying versions.

The issues with this option are numerous. On older kernels, such as
Ubuntu 14.04, where the persistent devname changes still hadn't landed,
it was common for the name of a VF or PF to change after they were used
by a VM (e.g. eth3->eth10). Even with the predictable devnames present
in later kernels, some udev configurations may result in the kernel/udev
not binding the PF or VF back to a NIC driver and may instead elect to
leave them bound to 'vfio-pci', meaning the device won't have a netdev
for the device. This breaks the PCI resource tracker (this was the cause
of [1]). Finally, while the rest of the fields work with all types of
PCI devices, the 'devname' field only works with NICs.

While we've already been advising people to not use this for quite some
time (at least downstream), people just keep shooting themselves in the
foot. Its deprecation is long overdue, in order to prod and eventually
force people to use one of the far more reliable alternatives, so do
just that.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1589796
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1590716
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1593290

Change-Id: Ia9d3fc7f52ce55332ae392cd5a70269cc4f4bfcc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>

commit_message:
mypy: Add type annotations

mypy is an experimental optional static type checker for Python that
aims to combine the benefits of dynamic (or "duck") typing and static
typing. While still in development, most features are supported and it's
already being used by real world projects like Sphinx.

This change adds initial support for mypy in os_vif. There are plenty of
rough edges here, particularly when it comes to o.vo, but we're able to
work around them and get something usable out of this.

Change-Id: I80e3343be12ea3ec0cdc07913507aea4c177a521
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ssync: don't log tracebacks for client disconnects

Previously a traceback was logged when the ssync receiver experienced
a problem reading the wsgi input. Now this is logged as an error but
without a traceback.

Change-Id: Ifadbe603d5fa5473397a32e14ae1b8023cb53eb2
Closes-Bug: #1889951

commit_message:
tq/release: ensure the gating repo is release aware

The gating repo is specific for the release.
This is critical for upgrade jobs.

The gating repo name is changed to gating-repo-$release
Then force copied to gating.repo for consistentcy
in https://review.opendev.org/c/765834

commit_message:
WIP Store timestamp on cache_bios_settings

The RFEs in Story: 2008301 and Story: 2008302 require that the user
know when exactly the BIOS settings were last refreshed. This change
does that by storing the timestamp in
driver_internal_info.last_bios_refresh.

Even though caching BIOS settings only happens during cleaning/managed
currently, it would still be useful to have this timestamp stored.

Marked as WIP until the RFEs are approved

Change-Id: I55591c231af816d648b7686bcccaa1689e734c7c
Story: 2008301
Task: 41324

commit_message:
repair operating status is offline

	Use POST /v2/lbaas/loadbalancers to create a fully populated load balancer, when it is successfully created, healthmonitor l7policy and l7rule operating_status is OFFLINE.

	When create load balancer, task flows don’t have Mark***ActiveInDB except MarkLBActiveInDB, it calls _mark_l7policy_status(), _mark_l7rule_status() and _mark_hm_status().

	According to classes Mark****ActiveInDB in this octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py, healthmonitor l7policy and l7rule updated its status, but there is no update operating_status in _mark_l7policy_status(), _mark_l7rule_status() and _mark_hm_status(). When loadbalancer created success, listener pool and member operating_status is changed in octavia/controller/healthmanager/health_drivers/update_db.py(def updated_health()), but there is no method to change the operating_status of healthmonitor l7policy and l7rule.

Change-Id: I2a665ad3b6b8803f8144c2b063102c89b508849b

commit_message:
S2007837: Fixes domain_id parameter in the user find call

Keystone database has domain stored in domain_id column
Find function call does not use domain_id since the parameter
was passed as domain instead of domain_id. This change fixes
the incorrect parameter name.

Story: 2007837
Task: 40124

Change-Id: I15b5f1463dadef750ff9e24fe510b06958eba188
(cherry picked from commit e79e76dadecf904dddab801790c9e008a46b68fa)

New pip version is quite strict and does not allow conflicting
minimum version deps in lower-constraints.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25613, 'name': 'Keigo Noha', 'email': 'knoha@redhat.com', 'username': 'knoha'}, {'_account_id': 31245, 'name': 'Daniel Bengtsson', 'email': 'dbengt@redhat.com', 'username': 'damani42'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 01:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/kernel.yaml'], 'message': "Remove dracut-config-generic package.

In LP#1830574, we introduce the dracut command to include necessary
file into initramfs. However, dracut in RHEL or CentOS doesn't include
sysctl.conf or other specific module related confs at an installation
of new kernel if dracut-config-generic package exists on the system.

We should remove the package to allow creating a host-specific initramfs
at an installation of new kernel.

Change-Id: Idbb69f4e05681f86933a7b57a506221cf6581536
Closes-bug: #1857493
Co-Authored-By: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 77229349f4d60df1cb5d1c039b9a7a879060a040)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove dracut-config-generic package.

In LP#1830574, we introduce the dracut command to include necessary
file into initramfs. However, dracut in RHEL or CentOS doesn't include
sysctl.conf or other specific module related confs at an installation
of new kernel if dracut-config-generic package exists on the system.

We should remove the package to allow creating a host-specific initramfs
at an installation of new kernel.

Change-Id: Idbb69f4e05681f86933a7b57a506221cf6581536
Closes-bug: #1857493
Co-Authored-By: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 77229349f4d60df1cb5d1c039b9a7a879060a040)

subject: [CI] Slim down
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 19:38:21.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.d/centos.yaml', '.zuul.d/ubuntu.yaml'], 'message': '[CI] Slim down

Move all extra jobs to the experimental pipeline.
Cores should know when to test these extras.
This is to reduce the load when a fix is needed in the base image
or across all images.
Otherwise, due to how CI works, we incur the cost of running
all these jobs on each recheck.

Change-Id: Ia4aecd2fbe70d1760e0ddc401d06510914dbd1fb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[CI] Slim down

Move all extra jobs to the experimental pipeline.
Cores should know when to test these extras.
This is to reduce the load when a fix is needed in the base image
or across all images.
Otherwise, due to how CI works, we incur the cost of running
all these jobs on each recheck.

Change-Id: Ia4aecd2fbe70d1760e0ddc401d06510914dbd1fb

commit_message:
Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client

We don't need an HTTP client for this, we only
need status codes.  Just load that instead.

https://docs.python.org/3/library/http.html

Change-Id: I1e96e12aad776dbb5b9454ed33e95bdce638b91d

commit_message:
Remove collections.abc backwards compatibility

The collections module moves some abstract classes into the abc
submodules in py3. While we supported older versions of python, we
needed to handle importing from either the old or new locations.

Now that we only support runtimes that include the collections.abc
module, we can remove the backwards compatibility handling we had for
the old location.

Change-Id: Idd106a8199fa586e0b34c054383d64218383c001
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Align lower-constraints for new pip

New pip version is quite strict and does not allow conflicting
minimum versions in lower-constraints.

Also adds irrelevant files for multinode job for it to not
run for any changes to those files.

Change-Id: I456a94ae5368fccc74e82032f79bc917345c94e4

commit_message:
Add the -n flag in the run parameters conversion script

The FFU procedure will fail to adjust the NIC templates for environments with composable roles because it will point to the default network data file. In order to circumvent this, we want to provide a means to provide custom network data, which is done by adding the -n flag to the run parameters conversion script.

Change-Id: I50426d2cc296e237fa8a8cf6c750e760b0992dd2

commit_message:
Stop invalidating suffixes post-SSYNC

We only need the invalidation post-rsync, since rsync was changing data
on disk behind Swift's back. Move the REPLICATE call down into the
rsync() helper function and drop it from the reconstructor entirely.

Change-Id: I576901344f1f3abb33b52b36fde0b25b43e54c8a
Closes-Bug: #1818709

commit_message:
Fix the handling of keystone groups in tempauth.

Standardizes on using NULL to separate groups and fixes the behavior
where keystoneauth would insert a tuple for remote_user.

Change-Id: I9f9c4360b54675bf5358a69ffad37897bce150e2

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer_agent_compute healthcheck

Health check of Ceilometer compute agent does not check connection to RabbitMQ,
but connection to Redis, hence it should not use the RpcPort parameter.

Change-Id: Ic573d5a1fa1d695d19934246fe4d48c0d3065eb1
(cherry picked from commit d63d2c63abf9d9b84057acc4e0efef687ae1a595)

Have REPLICATE with suffixes just append to hashes.invalid

This only applies to post-sync REPLICATE calls, none of which actually
look at the response anyway.

commit_message:
Temp install of podman>=1.6.4

Currently paunch rpm package building is broken and gates are
busted and in order to block it, we are installing podman during the
content provider job to unblock ci.

bindep is used during overcloud image build, will unblock the periodic
jobs.

Related-Bug: #1907193

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia6406102356c95d8b6c98dad90bdd821b073cffc

content provider job to unblock ci.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

subject: Disable openstack-lower-constraints-jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 20:34:48.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Disable openstack-lower-constraints-jobs

The community doesn't have a final solution, the following are what we found:

* virtualenv 20.2.2 released recently with pip bumped to 20.3.1
* pip before 20.3 is not actually satisfying the full dependency set and those
  issues were uncovered by the newer version.
* Disable this job for now until the community has a decent solution.

Change-Id: I8cd4554a20f89df92dbad4961d5a07a21f26fae8
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Disable openstack-lower-constraints-jobs

The community doesn't have a final solution, the following are what we found:

* virtualenv 20.2.2 released recently with pip bumped to 20.3.1
* pip before 20.3 is not actually satisfying the full dependency set and those
  issues were uncovered by the newer version.
* Disable this job for now until the community has a decent solution.

Change-Id: I8cd4554a20f89df92dbad4961d5a07a21f26fae8

commit_message:
Allow to proceed with role if ceph_conf_file is set

We shouldn't stop role execution if ceph_mons is an epty list, since
deployer can provide ceph_conf_file and keys instead.

Change-Id: I35b23e266aa9c5e29e79ea040994039e47242c9c
(cherry picked from commit 097673afa831fbf94dac28602bb7a8c5800c29d1)

subject: Fix lower-constraints job
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 11:23:31.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix lower-constraints job

pip 20.3 finally includes a proper dependency resolver. Its use is
causing the following error messages on the lower-constraints job:

  ERROR: Cannot install ... because these package versions have
  conflicting dependencies.

  The conflict is caused by:
      bandit 1.1.0 depends on PyYAML>=3.1.0

This is less self-explanatory but looking at the lower-constraints for
openstacksdk 0.52.0 shows a dependency on cryptography 2.7 [1], meaning
we need to bump this also.

Next up, flake8-import-order seems to cause the dependency resolver to
go nuts, eventually ending with the following error message in a Python
3.6 environment:

  Using cached enum34-1.1.2.zip (49 kB)
    ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
     command: ...
         cwd: ...
    Complete output (9 lines):
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File ".../lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 7, in <module>
        import setuptools.distutils_patch  # noqa: F401
      File ".../lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/distutils_patch.py", line 9, in <module>
        import re
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/re.py", line 142, in <module>
        class RegexFlag(enum.IntFlag):
    AttributeError: module 'enum' has no attribute 'IntFlag'
    ----------------------------------------

A quick Google suggests this is because the enum34 package is not
complete [2]. We shouldn't even be using it since our base virtualenv
should at least use Python 3.6, but I guess some dependency doesn't
properly restrict the dependency to <= Python 3.4. This is moved from
'test-requirements.txt' to 'tox.ini' since we don't need to use our
constraints machinery for linters.

Finally, the versions of bandit and hacking that pip is bringing in both
requires in a newer version of babel, which in turn requires a new
version of pytz.

  Collecting hacking>=2.0.0
  ...
  ERROR: Cannot install oslo.i18n because these package versions have
  conflicting dependencies.
  The conflict is caused by:
      babel 2.9.0 depends on pytz>=2015.7
      babel 2.8.1 depends on pytz>=2015.7
      babel 2.8.0 depends on pytz>=2015.7
      babel 2.7.0 depends on pytz>=2015.7

Seeing as we shouldn't be tracking bandit in
lower-constraints, I'm not sure why we're want to bump these
dependencies for just that. As above, we move these dependencies out of
'test-requirements' and into 'tox.ini' since we can do that for linters.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/tag/0.52.0/requirements.txt#L19
[2] https://github.com/iterative/dvc/issues/1995#issuecomment-491889669

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints job

pip 20.3 finally includes a proper dependency resolver. Its use is
causing the following error messages on the lower-constraints job:

  ERROR: Cannot install ... because these package versions have
  conflicting dependencies.

  The conflict is caused by:
      bandit 1.1.0 depends on PyYAML>=3.1.0
      cliff 3.4.0 depends on PyYAML>=3.12
      openstacksdk 0.52.0 depends on PyYAML>=3.13

Bump our lower constraint for PyYAML to resolve this issue. With that
resolved, we see a new issue:

  ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement
  cryptography>=2.7 (from openstacksdk)
  ERROR: No matching distribution found for cryptography>=2.7

This is less self-explanatory but looking at the lower-constraints for
openstacksdk 0.52.0 shows a dependency on cryptography 2.7 [1], meaning
we need to bump this also.

Next up, flake8-import-order seems to cause the dependency resolver to
go nuts, eventually ending with the following error message in a Python
3.6 environment:

  Using cached enum34-1.1.2.zip (49 kB)
    ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
     command: ...
         cwd: ...
    Complete output (9 lines):
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File ".../lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 7, in <module>
        import setuptools.distutils_patch  # noqa: F401
      File ".../lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/distutils_patch.py", line 9, in <module>
        import re
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/re.py", line 142, in <module>
        class RegexFlag(enum.IntFlag):
    AttributeError: module 'enum' has no attribute 'IntFlag'
    ----------------------------------------

A quick Google suggests this is because the enum34 package is not
complete [2]. We shouldn't even be using it since our base virtualenv
should at least use Python 3.6, but I guess some dependency doesn't
properly restrict the dependency to <= Python 3.4. This is moved from
'test-requirements.txt' to 'tox.ini' since we don't need to use our
constraints machinery for linters.

Finally, the versions of bandit and hacking that pip is bringing in both
requires in a newer version of babel, which in turn requires a new
version of pytz.

  Collecting hacking>=2.0.0
  ...
  ERROR: Cannot install oslo.i18n because these package versions have
  conflicting dependencies.
  The conflict is caused by:
      babel 2.9.0 depends on pytz>=2015.7
      babel 2.8.1 depends on pytz>=2015.7
      babel 2.8.0 depends on pytz>=2015.7
      babel 2.7.0 depends on pytz>=2015.7

Seeing as we shouldn't be tracking bandit in
lower-constraints, I'm not sure why we're want to bump these
dependencies for just that. As above, we move these dependencies out of
'test-requirements' and into 'tox.ini' since we can do that for linters.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/tag/0.52.0/requirements.txt#L19
[2] https://github.com/iterative/dvc/issues/1995#issuecomment-491889669

Change-Id: I8ec738fbcabc8d8553db79a876e5592576cd18fa
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tools: Allow check-cherry-picks.sh to be disabled by an env var

The checks performed by this script aren't always useful to downstream
consumers of the repo so allow them to disable the script without having
to make changes to tox.ini.

Change-Id: I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639

commit_message:
Move data_points to repository class

data_points_class can be now declared as a List or a Dictionary. The
latter is used when writing measurements per tenant. This refactoring
avoids creating the dictionary and then chaining again its values in
case of ElasticSearch and Cassandra databases or if db_per_tenant option
is disabled. The change also fixes the events pipeline.

Change-Id: I25ea80eea714acb167e70f188ed229cc90531596
Story: 2006331
Task: 37211
(cherry picked from commit e883b5bcda1a2e783f3789d108ead17a8b4df666)

commit_message:
Refactor processing of user commands

User commands in PTGbot can be called from privmsg or pubmsg.
Create a usercommands.py file to separate their processing.

This introduces a new '+' prefix for user commands, while preserving
the old '#' calls (which should really only be used for track
commands) for people that got used to them.

Change-Id: Ifab12fa27c6147ba9e9ff51f2b7f9e30a8ed0076

subject: Enhance simple usage API documentation
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-07 20:30:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enhance simple usage API documentation

Nova's `os-simple-tenant-usage` has the following statement.

```
Reports usage statistics of compute and storage resources periodically for an
individual tenant or all tenants. The usage statistics will include all
instances’ CPU, memory and local disk during a specific period.

```

To some people, when reading that, they might get the understanding that the
`os-simple-tenant-usage` will report the actual use of resources. Therefore,
if a VM is stopped and then started back again, it (the
`os-simple-tenant-usage`) would only report the time the VM has been up and
running. However, that is not what happens. The `os-simple-tenant-usage`
reports the time that a virtual machine (VM) exists in the cloud environment.
Therefore, actions such as pause, suspend, and stop do not affect the usage
accounting.

This might be a problem for people using this API for billing, or for people
that use other systems (e.g. CloudKitty) for billing. End-users might try to
cross-check the data from the billing from CloudKitty for instance, with the
usage report found in Horizon that uses this API, and the numbers will not add
up, as people might only consider the time a VM has been up and running to
charge users in CloudKitty.

An extension was proposed in [1], to allow operators to customize the usage
accounting. However, during a meeting with the community [2], the extension
was rejected for two reasons:

* Nova tries to avoid using config driven APIs. Meaning, APIs that change the
   response according to server-side configurations;
* The community has decided to get rid of usage and billing accounting in Nova.

Having said that, we would like to propose a documentation amendment. The idea
is to explicitly say for users/operators that the simple usage API only considers
the time that the VM existed in the cloud for the accounting, and not the actual
time it has been up and running. This will save some misunderstanding and misuse
of the API data.

References
===========
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/711113
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova/2020/nova.2020-12-03-16.00.log.txt

Closes-Bug: #1907133
Change-Id: Ic55669f5210b57f151f693393f205655765a8dc9

commit_message:
Enhance simple usage API documentation

Nova's `os-simple-tenant-usage` has the following statement.

```
Reports usage statistics of compute and storage resources periodically
for an individual tenant or all tenants. The usage statistics will
include all instances’ CPU, memory and local disk during a specific
period.

```

To some people, when reading that, they might get the understanding that
the `os-simple-tenant-usage` will report the actual use of resources.
Therefore, if a VM is stopped and then started back again, it (the
`os-simple-tenant-usage`) would only report the time the VM has been up
and running. However, that is not what happens. The
`os-simple-tenant-usage` reports the time that a virtual machine (VM)
exists in the cloud environment. Therefore, actions such as pause,
suspend, and stop do not affect the usage accounting.

This might be a problem for people using this API for billing, or for
people that use other systems (e.g. CloudKitty) for billing.
End-users might try to cross-check the data from the billing from
CloudKitty for instance, with the usage report found in Horizon that
uses this API, and the numbers will not add up, as people might only
consider the time a VM has been up and running to charge users in
CloudKitty.

An extension was proposed in [1], to allow operators to customize
the usage accounting. However, during a meeting with the community [2],
the extension was rejected for two reasons:

* Nova tries to avoid using config driven APIs. Meaning, APIs that change
  the response according to server-side configurations;
* The community has decided to get rid of usage and billing accounting
  in Nova.

Having said that, we would like to propose a documentation amendment.
The idea is to explicitly say for users/operators that the simple usage
API only considers the time that the VM existed in the cloud for the
accounting, and not the actual time it has been up and running.
This will save some misunderstanding and misuse of the API data.

References
===========
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/711113
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova/2020/nova.2020-12-03-16.00.log.txt

Closes-Bug: #1907133
Change-Id: Ic55669f5210b57f151f693393f205655765a8dc9

commit_message:
Update makefile for chart packaging

This change adds a new makefile target to be utilized by the
chart publishing job, specifically one that is compatible with
helm 3. This should fix the publish job not posting
tarballs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/765634

Change-Id: I3551f691e6c3221b8afb201d8030be538424161b

commit_message:
Disable openstack-lower-constraints-jobs

The community doesn't have a final solution, the following are what we found:

* virtualenv 20.2.2 released recently with pip bumped to 20.3.1
* pip before 20.3 is not actually satisfying the full dependency set and those
  issues were uncovered by the newer version.
* Disable this job for now until the community has a decent solution

Change-Id: Ib4a59ae54cc6d86234226ad8b78fbb0058cc02de

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints with the new pip resolver

* move pep8 dependencies from test-requirements to tox.ini,
  they're not needed there and are hard to constraint properly.
* bump docutils required by sphinx

Change-Id: I349056b953878fa53ac43f37428e72411376038b

commit_message:
Update kernel args grub file entry inline with upgrade changes

For FFU, leapp tool requires the /etc/default/grub file
to have entries to start with "GRUB". upgrade_steps for
ffu has been updated to fix it for FFU. Align the args
with the same name for the fresh deployment too.

NOTE(stable/train): Fixed molecule configs and files.

Related-Bug: #1890769
Change-Id: I2349f30d2159e068ebdb453372050459b7a78c65
(cherry picked from commit e0ece7e5a3ea3fc3b451963a7bab4ae0ece12600)

commit_message:
Fix two CI issues

* Fix lower-constraints with the new pip resolver

  First, remove pep8 dependencies from test-requirements, they're not
  needed there and are hard to constraint properly.

  Second, bump keystoneauth to the version required by openstacksdk.

* Force updating libgcrypt to work around CentOS/RHEL 8.3 bug
  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1840485

Change-Id: I65379a3d1b42e3607118bd785f580604bef7d10d

commit_message:
Bump virtualenv to version prior to 20.2.2

Recently released virtualenv breaks linter jobs. In order to prevent this
we temporary fix it's version before this release

Make centos-8 job non-voting as fixing centos 8.3 creates a circular
dependancy on this patch.

Change-Id: I1dc269944445a1493c0008d9f318db56d9f0274f

subject: Update lower-constraints
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 11:23:31.000000000', 'files': ['lower-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Update lower-constraints

This had gotten pretty out-of-date and included a whole load of OSC
plugins which I don't think we need to track from here. This updated
version is simply generated via 'pip freeze' using pip >= 20.3, which
includes the new dependency resolver.

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints

This had gotten pretty out-of-date and included a whole load of OSC
plugins which I don't think we need to track from here. This updated
version is simply generated via 'pip freeze' using pip >= 20.3, which
includes the new dependency resolver.

Change-Id: I4fb0b69dbd538f313c6fef97126c22078904c69f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
OSSA-2020-008: add missing links for some branches

The original advisory omitted URLs for fixes on branches newer than
stable/train, so add those for all other branches where similar
patches merged.

Note the outstanding changes for branches earlier than stable/stein
are proposed but not currently passing CI jobs and have yet to be
reviewed, so they're not included here.

subject: compute: Skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON when cross_az_attach unavailable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22873, 'name': 'Martin Kopec', 'email': 'mkopec@redhat.com', 'username': 'mkopec'}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-30 19:47:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'compute: Skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON when cross_az_attach unavailable

Both tests within this class create an instance and volume within the
same availability zone before shelving the instance. By default this
fully offloads the instance removing it from the availability zone.

If [cinder]/cross_az_attach is set to False within nova.conf this then
results in failures to attach volumes to the instance as they no longer
share the same availability zone.

To avoid this we now skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON based on the value
of [compute-feature-enabled]/cross_az_attach in tempest.conf introduced
by I34b365d23c70eb5f7b4695a32d7cf4efd6a152ae. This should match the
value of [cinder]/cross_az_attach ensuring these tests are only ran when
we are able to attach the volumes to the fully offloaded instances.

Closes-Bug: #1889687
Change-Id: Ic51f6c7671bae2b241ada6d0c75fd9ea410eb73b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-12-01 22:14:21.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_attach_volume.py'], 'message': 'compute: Skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON when cross_az_attach unavailable

Both tests within this class create an instance and volume within the
same availability zone before shelving the instance. By default this
fully offloads the instance removing it from the availability zone.

If [cinder]/cross_az_attach is set to False within nova.conf this then
results in failures to attach volumes to the instance as they no longer
share the same availability zone.

To avoid this we now skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON based on the value
of [compute-feature-enabled]/compute_volume_common_az in tempest.conf
introduced by 979e494da246711751e97236e2681d6db9bd3e4e. This should be set if
cinder]/cross_az_attach is False within nova.conf ensuring that the resources
will be created in the same AZ.

Closes-Bug: #1889687
Change-Id: Ic51f6c7671bae2b241ada6d0c75fd9ea410eb73b
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
compute: Skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON when cross_az_attach unavailable

Both tests within this class create an instance and volume within the
same availability zone before shelving the instance. By default this
fully offloads the instance removing it from the availability zone.

If [cinder]/cross_az_attach is set to False within nova.conf this then
results in failures to attach volumes to the instance as they no longer
share the same availability zone.

To avoid this we now skip AttachVolumeShelveTestJSON based on the value
of [compute-feature-enabled]/compute_volume_common_az in tempest.conf
introduced by 979e494da246711751e97236e2681d6db9bd3e4e. This should be set if
cinder]/cross_az_attach is False within nova.conf ensuring that the resources
will be created in the same AZ.

Closes-Bug: #1889687
Change-Id: Ic51f6c7671bae2b241ada6d0c75fd9ea410eb73b

commit_message:
Move tacker-horizon to new hacking 4.0.0

New rule enforcement has been enabled in the latest hacking code.

This patch bumps new version of hacking in test-requirements file,
for early detection and to avoid code breakage later when hacking
changes are released.

Additionally addresses dependencies,
flake8 3.8.4 depends on mccabe==0.6.0 and pyflakes==2.1.1.
These Dependencies mccabe==0.6.0 and pyflakes==2.1.1. are internal
requirement for hacking which is managed by hacking itself[1],
removing those from tacker-horizon so that they can be pulled by
hacking as per compatible version.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/hacking/blob/4.0.0/lower-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I4a83f8a783380475071f2e4b62e3c5b7dd9bca2b

[{'created': '2020-09-16 17:36:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP/DNM - Flavor and image defined ephemeral storage encryption

Very much a WIP at the moment but feel free to comment on the high level
approach being taken here.

The following specs will also be posted shortly

  - libvirt ephemeral storage encryption rework

    Covering a migration path from the existing implementation to a new
    implmentation available across all imagebackends.

  - block_device_mapping_v2 defined ephemeral storage encryption

    Covering changes in the API to allow users to make fine grain
    requests for specific ephemeral disks to be encrypted.

  - os-rotate-secrets

    A new instance action API to allow the secrets associated to a
    SHUTDOWN instance to be rotated.

Change-Id: I23379c73be6f7215b5cb31b523ff5371ee17c038

commit_message:
Image and flavor defined ephemeral storage encryption

This spec introduces the API, compute and high level virt layer changes
required by a new image and flavor defined approach to ephemeral storage
encryption.

Future specs will detail the required changes by individual virt drivers
to introduce support for specific encryption formats and options.

Part of blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I23379c73be6f7215b5cb31b523ff5371ee17c038

subject: Remove race due to 1907084
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-07 14:38:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove race due to 1907084

The test_attach_scsi_disk_with_config_drive test cases is racy at volume
detach. Nova first detach the volume in cinder then later deletes the
BlockDeviceMapping from the nova DB. Test waits for the volume to become
available and then checks the list of volume attachments in the nova API
then it can see that the attachment is still there.

Closes-Bug: #1907084
Change-Id: I814ae3215f39d1e8407c4ca1c7117a314941c80b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-12-07 15:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_volume.py', 'tempest/tests/common/test_waiters.py', 'tempest/common/waiters.py'], 'message': 'Remove race due to 1907084

The test_attach_scsi_disk_with_config_drive test cases is racy at volume
detach. Nova first detach the volume in cinder then later deletes the
BlockDeviceMapping from the nova DB. Test waits for the volume to become
available and then checks the list of volume attachments in the nova API
then it can see that the attachment is still there.

Closes-Bug: #1907084
Change-Id: I814ae3215f39d1e8407c4ca1c7117a314941c80b
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove race due to 1907084

The test_attach_scsi_disk_with_config_drive test cases is racy at volume
detach. Nova first detach the volume in cinder then later deletes the
BlockDeviceMapping from the nova DB. Test waits for the volume to become
available and then checks the list of volume attachments in the nova API
then it can see that the attachment is still there.

Closes-Bug: #1907084
Change-Id: I814ae3215f39d1e8407c4ca1c7117a314941c80b

`overcloud cell export` command does not have option

data is exported to custom directory.

This change add the option for `overcloud cell export` command

Change-Id: I8e2a0922662c0a4d913469fcf2b3180d31512b0f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add config-download-dir flag to cell export command

`overcloud cell export` command does not have option
to provide from where to copy export data if config-download
data is exported to custom directory.

This change add the option for `overcloud cell export` command
to provide custom directory.

Change-Id: I8e2a0922662c0a4d913469fcf2b3180d31512b0f

Tempest will create a tenant network for us and manage it
all so no need to do this within this plugin.

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2020-10-22 16:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_volume.py', 'tempest/api/compute/base.py'], 'message': "Test attach scsi disk with config drive enabled

when finding the next available SCSI address when
attaching the volume, so for example if the instance
has config drive in the shape of a SCSI CDROM, it's
SCSI address gets ignored in the new address calculation
and thus there will be address collision in the xml and

This test will actually covers the same scenario by
enabling the config drive and attach/detach the volume
to the instance that is boot up using the custom image
meta property hw_cdrom_bus and hw_disk_bus as scsi
with virtio-scsi mode.

method created that will copy the default image used
in the conf. and then updating it with the custom
property mentioned in the attach scsi volume test.

admin priviliges for image_client so hence adding the
test here in admin tests with updating the image_client
with admin privilege in compute admin test class.

Related-Bug: #1867075

Change-Id: I9c7be55aaa363860a78d2efe2a4685433777625b
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Test attach scsi disk with config drive enabled

There were recently issues discovered in nova as it
used to consider only an instance's existing volumes
when finding the next available SCSI address when
attaching the volume, so for example if the instance
has config drive in the shape of a SCSI CDROM, it's
SCSI address gets ignored in the new address calculation
and thus there will be address collision in the xml and
libvirt will complain and hence the attachment to volume
failed with the error that the doamin already contains
the disk with that address.

This test will actually covers the same scenario by
enabling the config drive and attach/detach the volume
to the instance that is boot up using the custom image
meta property hw_cdrom_bus and hw_disk_bus as scsi
with virtio-scsi mode.

There is an additional create_image_with custom prop.
method created that will copy the default image used
in the conf. and then updating it with the custom
property mentioned in the attach scsi volume test.

Also to create an image with the custom property needs
admin priviliges for image_client so hence adding the
test here in admin tests with updating the image_client
with admin privilege in compute admin test class.

Related-Bug: #1867075

Change-Id: I9c7be55aaa363860a78d2efe2a4685433777625b

commit_message:
Disable caching done by ganesha

Disable caching done by ganesha when ganesha
is used as CephFS's gateway (manila's usecase)

This is the recommended Ganesha setting as libcephfs
already caches information. Doing so helps avoid
cache incoherency issues.

Change-Id: Iacd575ac61b39ab9dcf8814514b5e3267570a17f
Closes-Bug: #1898950

username parameter of get_remote_client() method.

commit_message:
Move python-tackerclient to new hacking 4.0.0

New rule enforcement has been enabled in the latest hacking code.

This patch bumps new version of hacking in test-requirements file,
for early detection and to avoid code breakage later when hacking
changes are released.

Change-Id: Ic54af7096b58259d6ee434a743ce9b75b7b61f28

commit_message:
Pin Bandit on py2

...and, since the previous tag didn't have the Bandit pin, make the
rolling upgrade job non-voting. We should plan on backporting this so we
can check that upgrades from stable branches are still OK.

See also: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/654

Change-Id: If7f3ad8b275271d748426133232ed06c2a1cd1de

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 04:09:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Omit resource inventories from placement update if zero

When a compute node has zero total available for the MEMORY_MB or
DISK_GB resource classes, we attempt to PUT an inventory with 'total'
of 0 which isn't allowed by the placement API. Doing this results in
a 400 error from placement "JSON does not validate: 0 is less than the
minimum of 1" and ResourceProviderUpdateFailed and
ResourceProviderSyncFailed raised in nova.

We are already omitting most resource classes when their available
amount of the resource is 0 and we just need to also do it for
MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB.

TODO: Test coverage

Closes-Bug: #1901120

Change-Id: I022f3bbddbbdc24362b10004f273da2421788c97

commit_message:
Omit resource inventories from placement update if zero

When a compute node has zero total available for the:

  * MEMORY_MB
  * DISK_GB
  * VGPU
  * PMEM_NAMESPACE_*

resource classes, we attempt to PUT an inventory with 'total' of 0
which isn't allowed by the placement API. Doing this results in a 400
error from placement "JSON does not validate: 0 is less than the
minimum of 1" and ResourceProviderUpdateFailed and
ResourceProviderSyncFailed raised in nova.

We are already omitting most resource classes when their total amount
of the resource is 0 and we just need to also do it for the
aforementioned resource classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901120
Closes-Bug: #1906494

Change-Id: I022f3bbddbbdc24362b10004f273da2421788c97

commands.

commit_message:
Remove /etc/ceph dependency on puppet services

In tripleo-heat-templates a new 'CephConfigPath' parameter
is introduced with the purpose of customizing the path where the
Ceph config and keyring files are created on the host.
This change makes sure that puppet-tripleo is able to consume
a custom location for the Ceph config and keyring files.

Closes-Bug: #1708302
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iaabb66cd26f0246defe391a4e34f4eab3c3c5fee

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Remove default OSD configuration

The default, directory-based OSD configuration doesn't appear to work
correctly and isn't really being used by anyone. It has been commented
out and the comments have been enhanced to document the OSD config
better. With this change there is no default configuration anymore, so
the user must configure OSDs properly in their environment in
values.yaml in order to deploy OSDs using this chart.

Change-Id: I8caecf847ffc1fefe9cb1817d1d2b6d58b297f72

commit_message:
Enable cephFS snapshots in manila

To use the snapshots capability that the cephfs drivers have
we need to set the share type extra spec enable_snapshot support
to True

Change-Id: I45dddd49578eaca81276bbf44a44701c80b8a8c4

subject: [Stable Only] Handle libvirt reporting incorrect 4k page quantities
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 09:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "[Stable Only] Handle libvirt reporting incorrect 4k page quantities

libvirt < 4.3.0 had an issue whereby assigning more than 4 GB of huge
pages would result in an incorrect value for the number of 4k (small)
pages [1]. This was fixed in 4.3.0 and the fixes appear to have been
backported to the libvirt versions for RHEL 7.4+.  However, this is
still an issue with the versions of libvirt available on Ubuntu 16.04,
18.04 and who knows what else. Work around the issue using the rest of
the (correct) values for different page sizes and warn the user so they
know what's going on.

This is stable only since the minimum version of libvirt was bumped in
Victoria, meaning this no longer applies there.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1569678

Change-Id: I28a7222d3ab80bb05e10caf753b4e78be2603c30
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811870
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[Stable Only] Handle libvirt reporting incorrect 4k page quantities

libvirt < 4.3.0 had an issue whereby assigning more than 4 GB of huge
pages would result in an incorrect value for the number of 4k (small)
pages [1]. This was fixed in 4.3.0 and the fixes appear to have been
backported to the libvirt versions for RHEL 7.4+.  However, this is
still an issue with the versions of libvirt available on Ubuntu 16.04,
18.04 and who knows what else. Work around the issue using the rest of
the (correct) values for different page sizes and warn the user so they
know what's going on.

This is stable only since the minimum version of libvirt was bumped in
Victoria, meaning this no longer applies there.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1569678

Change-Id: I28a7222d3ab80bb05e10caf753b4e78be2603c30
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811870

subject: Update build-chart playbook
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 23:33:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/build-chart.yaml'], 'message': 'Update build-chart playbook

The build-chart playbook task to point each chart to helm-toolkit
has a find command that when used with another repo, will
include the charts for osh-infra as well.

This change modifies the playbook to only modify requirements
in charts in the repo being published.

Change-Id: I493b4c64fe2525bac0acae06bd40c3896c918e20
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update build-chart playbook

The build-chart playbook task to point each chart to helm-toolkit
has a find command that when used with another repo, will
include the charts for osh-infra as well.

This change modifies the playbook to only modify requirements
in charts in the repo being published.

Change-Id: I493b4c64fe2525bac0acae06bd40c3896c918e20

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-25 07:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/image/v2/test_images.py'], 'message': "Fix TypeError when there exists image with size None

When there exists image with size None(e.g.,images whose status is
queued), test_list_images_param_sort will raise TypeError:
TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'NoneType',
So we should ignore images with size None.

Change-Id: Ie084c65303238eaeff0a753915356d72aa039434
Closes-Bug: #1905515
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError when there exists image with size None

When there exists image with size None(e.g.,images whose status is
queued), test_list_images_param_sort will raise TypeError:
TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'NoneType',
So we should ignore images with size None.

Change-Id: Ie084c65303238eaeff0a753915356d72aa039434
Closes-Bug: #1905515

any longer.

commit_message:
Fallback to rdo registry if quay gets down

Currently we pull registry2 container from quay and sometimes
quay also gets down.

This patch adds a rescue method to fallback to rdo registry to
pull registry2 content.

Change-Id: I037f38ced5f73135aa0ea5c62b9a844166b2c185
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Build container images in ci centos gate job

Like other zuul jobs let's also build containers
in ci centos jobs instead of pulling from docker.io
where requests are rate limited.

Also use ubi8:8.2 for #1902846.

Related-Bug: #1902846
Depends-On: Iad71c1af41b2039591eccdb420c2a35b05ade4ac
Change-Id: If99fc787109495f8ce7ed5556243a7ed8f74537e

commit_message:
Retire the qinling-dashboard project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Qinling project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires the qinling-dashboard repository as per
process deinfed in project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to
maintain it again, please revert back this commit and propose
the re-adding it to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the qinling-dashboard project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764520
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764523

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018638.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: Ib1953185ed61f237040a9e4e5e727fd5e2befdb8

commit_message:
lower-constraints: Bump packaging to 20.4

This version of packaging is actually required by oslo.utils as of 4.5
by Ic9bda0783d3664e1f518d513d81b3271028335fd that was itself introduced
as a lower-constraints version within Nova as of
Ic4d3b998bb9701cb1e3ef12d9bb6f4d91cc19c18.

Change-Id: I67255fa1b919a27e92028da95d71ddd4bf53edc1
Closes-Bug: #1907117

subject: tripleo_deploy_artifacts has wrong tar syntax
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-07 19:53:40.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_deploy_artifacts.py', 'tripleo_ansible/tests/modules/test_tripleo_deploy_artifacts.py'], 'message': 'tripleo_deploy_artifacts has wrong tar syntax

The archive name should be immediately preceded by the f flag. Also,
removing stderr redirection to facilitate troubleshooting in case
something goes wrong like this.

This also includes a new unittest to validate that deploy_targz
actually works.

Change-Id: I71ebab9a2f595892e64c78688ecbb4502812fc0b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tripleo_deploy_artifacts has wrong tar syntax

The archive name should be immediately preceded by the f flag. Also,
removing stderr redirection to facilitate troubleshooting in case
something goes wrong like this.

This also includes a new unittest to validate that deploy_targz
actually works.

Change-Id: I71ebab9a2f595892e64c78688ecbb4502812fc0b

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7735b166a92921a11a82446638b60a2fbb304889

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-03 21:52:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enhance os-simple-tenant-usage VM hours accounting

The accounting of VM's running hours of os-simple-tenant-usage API
method is wrong (is our perspective). If there are multiple, and different
events such as start/stop/pause/resume, the method will not catch all of these
different situations and account partially the number of hours that the
VM was running in the given period. Of course, in the docs it says that it
will account only the diff between the creation time, and the current (end of period)
time. However, the method is called `usage`, and this led us to believe that it would report
usage data, and not only allocation data.

We mapped some use cases that the method does not work with the previous implementation:
- VM was stopped for the given period: the VM was stopped, and was started in the given period.
 Therefore, we need a partial accounting only for the running time.
- The VM was running, and it was stopped: The VM was running, it was stopped, and then started back again.
 Therefore, we should only account for the running times of the VM (discarding the period it was stopped).
- If the VM was terminated, it would only consider the last time the VM was launched
 to execute the calculation. However, this is wrong (even by the method documentation).

The bug was discovered in Rocky, Nova version 18.0.1. The implementation of the method is still the same
in Master. We also think that there are other inconsistencies in this method, but we will address them one by one.

This implementation does not change the old behavior. It is preserved by default, in case someone needs it.
We just enable operators to customize it; so, they can tailor their business needs.

Change-Id: I3594e66e62b82048062ad4fc502a354e2a7086da

commit_message:
Enhance os-simple-tenant-usage VM hours accounting

The accounting of VM's running hours of os-simple-tenant-usage API
method is wrong (is our perspective). If there are multiple, and different
events such as start/stop/pause/resume, the method will not catch all of these
different situations and account partially the number of hours that the
VM was running in the given period. Of course, in the docs it says that it
will account only the diff between the creation time, and the current (end of period)
time. However, the method is called `usage`, and this led us to believe that it would
report usage data, and not only allocation data.

We mapped some use cases that the method does not work with the previous implementation:
- VM was stopped for the given period: the VM was stopped, and was started in the
 given period. Therefore, we need a partial accounting only for the running time.
- The VM was running, and it was stopped: The VM was running, it was stopped, and then
 started back again. Therefore, we should only account for the running times of the VM
 (discarding the period it was stopped).
- If the VM was terminated, it would only consider the last time the VM was launched
 to execute the calculation. However, this is wrong (even by the method documentation).

The bug was discovered in Rocky, Nova version 18.0.1. The implementation of the method is
still the same in Master. We also think that there are other inconsistencies in this
method, but we will address them one by one.

This implementation does not change the old behavior. It is preserved by default, in case
someone needs it. We just enable operators to customize it; so, they can tailor their
business needs.

Change-Id: I3594e66e62b82048062ad4fc502a354e2a7086da

commit_message:
Retire the python-qinlingclient project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Qinling project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires the python-qinlingclient repository as per
process deinfed in project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to
maintain it again, please revert back this commit and propose
the re-adding it to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the python-qinlingclient project over
the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764520
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764523
Change-Id: Idc709077f3f1fbbc81795b32a0cf5fc005f3dd27

subject: Stop NetworkManager from updating resolv.conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-07 03:09:22.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-bootstrap/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Stop NetworkManager from updating resolv.conf

cloud-init creates /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/99-cloud-init.conf,
for NetworkManager to not update resolv.conf. However, subsequent
update of NetworkManager seems to remove that file as there is no
config(noreplace) directive for it. So after an update/upgrade of
overcloud nodes, reboot would cleanup the dns entries.

cloud-init do configuration only one time during first instance
boot. So this would ensure resolv.conf is not touched during
subsequent reboots.

Change-Id: I989e3f1d14fd33e97933032111cf48166dc5f50c
(cherry picked from commit 6881079d12a9fb2cf752a5f56116c1b4d3a7b75d)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop NetworkManager from updating resolv.conf

cloud-init creates /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/99-cloud-init.conf,
for NetworkManager to not update resolv.conf. However, subsequent
update of NetworkManager seems to remove that file as there is no
config(noreplace) directive for it. So after an update/upgrade of
overcloud nodes, reboot would cleanup the dns entries.

cloud-init do configuration only one time during first instance
boot. So this would ensure resolv.conf is not touched during
subsequent reboots.

Change-Id: I989e3f1d14fd33e97933032111cf48166dc5f50c
(cherry picked from commit 6881079d12a9fb2cf752a5f56116c1b4d3a7b75d)

commit_message:
Client support for custom initial number of replicas

Added support to specify the initial number of replica sets during
runtime creation. If not specified, the number of replicas in conf file
is taken as default.

Change-Id: I19c584d5b68e5d2eb0bbc4fe21b31d0c77619280
Task: 23217
Story: 2003095

subject: Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 01:49:54.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I9f2fd081b0eea58f0f270436af424696ffeaeeb0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I9f2fd081b0eea58f0f270436af424696ffeaeeb0

subject: Retire the Qinling project
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-28 03:00:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Retire the Qinling project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Qinling project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires this repository as per process deinfed in
project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain it again, please
revert back this commit and propose the re-adding of Qinling
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the Qinling project over the years.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018638.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: Ic9e422dfbba6d23cf83576ece34bb5071cc89377

commit_message:
Retire the Qinling project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Qinling project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires this repository as per process deinfed in
project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain it again, please
revert back this commit and propose the re-adding of Qinling
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the Qinling project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764520
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764523
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018638.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: Ic9e422dfbba6d23cf83576ece34bb5071cc89377

commit_message:
Provide hypervisor_hostname in Hypervisor object

This is a primary field of a Hypervisor, like stack_name in heat
stacks, but we're not using the alias mechanism to continue to
provide access to it. Add an alias.

Change-Id: I6a270cead522e272257113a19d3596d85a916b59

restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

subject: optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-03 06:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['runtimes/python2/Dockerfile', 'runtimes/python3/Dockerfile', 'tools/docker/Dockerfile', 'runtimes/sidecar/Dockerfile'], 'message': "optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Ice4040d8cc62494f8eab835631c5b0883656f812
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Ice4040d8cc62494f8eab835631c5b0883656f812
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

subject: [train][goal] Define new 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only' job in gate
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-30 12:53:21.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35922

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ib223233c43db58db8d7762a32e48029c8ff6f5db
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'qinling-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35922

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ib223233c43db58db8d7762a32e48029c8ff6f5db

commit_message:
Add Apparmor for prometheus os exporter ks-user Job

 1) Updated docker image for heat to point to Stein and Bionic
 2) Enabled Apparmor Job for prometheus-openstack exporter.

commit_message:
Retire the searchlight-spec project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Searchlight project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires searchlight-spec repository as per process deinfed in
project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain it again, please
revert back this commit and propose the re-adding it
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the searchlight-spec project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764519
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764530

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018637.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: Ibbe1d916be8047f2fe48be7b6b79ff8f9196662b

not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be

commit_message:
Searchlight Client Library

Most of the services in openstack have notification
events which are sent in near real-time for the
ongoing changes to service data.

For services which don't generate any notifications,
searchlight cannot keep the data in elasticsearch
updated with latest changes in source service.

Client Library provides direct indexing to elasticsearch
from swift.

Change-Id: Ibeacb4aa90ea2d7e6510115fc9f47b5d66b018ab
Implements: blueprint swift-direct-indexing-library

commit_message:
Policy driven RBAC

Searchlight implements RBAC using Elasticsearch filters

Moving these filters to be based on OSLO Policy file
format allows to modify the policy outside the code
and use the popular policy syntax.

Change-Id: I922f2220fed7c97af202fa02fc7a188b7083bbc8

commit_message:
Retire the searchlight-ui project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Searchlight project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires searchlight-ui repository as per process deinfed in
project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain it again, please
revert back this commit and propose the re-adding it
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the searchlight-ui project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764519
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764530

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018637.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: I7673aa464f122c8ddaa1a2c346ceb6aa59daae24

subject: Searchlight Magic Search Data Binding

Refactor the searchlight-ui to use data-binding instead of events where possible.
This results in a set of components that are FAR easier to use, maintain, re-use
and re-organize. This paves the way for future changes that will allow saved
search results, dynamic search table columns and generic search widgets.

At a high-level, this is easiest to understand by looking at the new search-page
directive which contains a sl-magic-search-bar and a search-table. These directives
communicate by using two-way bindings to data on the search-page controller to respond
to changes in the search settings, available facets, current search text and currently
selected facets.

Also, the search table controller no longer uses events in most cases to communicate with
its utility servies like search settings or search helper.

commit_message:
Searchlight Magic Search Data Binding

Refactor the searchlight-ui to use data-binding instead of events where possible.
This results in a set of components that are FAR easier to use, maintain, re-use
and re-organize. This paves the way for future changes that will allow saved
search results, dynamic search table columns and generic search widgets.

At a high-level, this is easiest to understand by looking at the new search-page
directive which contains a sl-magic-search-bar and a search-table. These directives
communicate by using two-way bindings to data on the search-page controller to respond
to changes in the search settings, available facets, current search text and currently
selected facets.

Also, the search table controller no longer uses events in most cases to communicate with
its utility servies like search settings or search helper.

Depends-On: I4a74a6630cb6ef6515b240855ee68283ef41eff3
Implements: blueprint data-binding-over-events
Change-Id: Ica6c1c3c2041d1c4b84bca0986feb418c8f00636

An experiment to demonstrate changing the search results table columns
to be specific to a given resource, when all items in the search
results are the same type.

To use, run a Horizon that has table column registrations, such as
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261376 or
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309561

Change-Id: Ia253cb894550ed9085f3191c97ea168b0e12b1bb

commit_message:
WIP - Dynamic table columns

An experiment to demonstrate changing the search results table columns
to be specific to a given resource, when all items in the search
results are the same type.

To use, run a Horizon that has table column registrations, such as
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261376 or
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309561

Change-Id: Ia253cb894550ed9085f3191c97ea168b0e12b1bb

commit_message:
Add Instance Usage Aggregation to Image panel

This adds an aggregation count of the number
of instances that an image is used by to the
Angular Images panel in Horizon.

http://imgur.com/a/l7S00

Change-Id: Ib2b4cc5afb5d15806442646d0dd251ff996c3c44
Implements-Blueprint: horizon-image-instance-aggregation

commit_message:
Integrating sl-magic-search and searchlight-ui

Changes to make it easier to iterate on searchlight-ui including:
- using data binding to communicate between the search results
  and the search input
- using a simple HTML table instead of smart-table

This patch depends on several small Horizon core changes (below).

Depends-On: Ic0b0c7af6143ec1d654cb277503342693d051b50
Depends-On: I24b4fcb3df87f018d9d73aa9d1526d7b8c6026bb
Change-Id: I9dcb0f978787477cd74fa5150df60c8efd7f5fa8

commit_message:
Searchlight wrapper for Magic Search

Introduce a wrapper around magic-search that hides the difficult to
use Magic Search events. This paves the way for a search
table that can use a normal 'table' instead of smart table, and
uses data binding to communicate with magic search.

Use of this new component is demonstrated in a follow-on patch.

Change-Id: I48ad327389e365a3d6c8d4b3661c4ca7834b05fd
Implements: blueprint data-binding-over-events

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I5f3aaa009c16e7d2339251a36a2845a893a55773

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Searchlight project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires python-searchlightclient repository as per
process deinfed in project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of

over the years.

commit_message:
Retire the python-searchlightclient project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Searchlight project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires python-searchlightclient repository as per
process deinfed in project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain
it again, please revert back this commit and propose the re-adding it
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the python-searchlightclient project
over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764519
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764530

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018637.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository
