commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I8c715b7e0c964fcf0bc506e1ae546a05e18166b8

subject: Bump default tox env from py37 to py38
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:35:07.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I3c7240119435b1f4d9816470f949429d4de63ca2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I3c7240119435b1f4d9816470f949429d4de63ca2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Retire the Searchlight project
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-28 03:49:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Retire the Searchlight project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Searchlight project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires this repository as per process deinfed in
project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain it again, please
revert back this commit and propose the re-adding of Searchlight
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the Searchlight project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764519

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018637.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: I0c5c9a961cca19113f4d59e37cb16e3bc0ccf8e1

commit_message:
Retire the Searchlight project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Searchlight project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires this repository as per process deinfed in
project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to maintain it again, please
revert back this commit and propose the re-adding of Searchlight
to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the Searchlight project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764519
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764530

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id44afb354ba5ac88dc26ebef4f5c8d64cddf71e4

subject: Use 'ip' type for ipv6 if available
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-09 23:07:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP Use 'ip' type for ipv6 if available

Under Elasticsearch 5 we can use the 'ip' type for ipv6 addresses.
This patch detects which server version is running and uses the
appropriate field type.

This is WIP because I'm not 100% happy with the caching, which in
turns is unfortunately necessary because the facet code has to call
get_mapping() which in turn has to check the ES server version. In
an ideal world we'd have abstracted the mappings a bit, but I need to
think about it a bit more.

commit_message:
Use 'ip' type for ipv6 if available

Under Elasticsearch 5 we can use the 'ip' type for ipv6 addresses.
This patch detects which server version is running and uses the
appropriate field type.

This adds a configuration parameter 'supports_ipv6' and a check to
make sure the running version seems compatible with it. Doing it all
dynamically is hard at present because the facet code requires the
full mapping, which results in lots of version checks or implementing
caching which is tricky. This options may be able to be removed fairly
shortly in any case.

Change-Id: Ie5e9cae3dbae01afb875d4150afc058648bd042c
Blueprint: bp/use-ip-type-for-ipv6

subject: Map 'ipv4_addresses' and 'ipv6_addresses'
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-05 16:57:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Map 'ipv4_addresses' and 'ipv6_addresses'

Searching by IP is something that's extremely useful. It's also a bit
tricky currently since the various resource types map the information in
wildly different ways and it's often in nested objects which are hard to
query with query_strings. This patch adds ipv4_addresses (type:ip) and
ipv6_addresses(type:string-not-analyzed until we move to elasticsearch 5
which has support for ipv6) for resource types where it makes sense
(port, router, floating-ip (v4 only), servers). This makes it easy to
query e.g. "ipv4_addresses:18.0.50.0\\/24"

Change-Id: I0d850a1576332b910698e2b5da327f792c1518ca

commit_message:
Map 'ipv4_addresses' and 'ipv6_addresses'

Searching by IP is something that's extremely useful. It's also a bit
tricky currently since the various resource types map the information in
wildly different ways and it's often in nested objects which are hard to
query with query_strings. This patch adds ipv4_addresses (type:ip) and
ipv6_addresses(type:string-not-analyzed until we move to elasticsearch 5
which has support for ipv6) for resource types where it makes sense
(port, router, floating-ip (v4 only), subnets, servers, hypervisors).
This makes it easy to query e.g. "ipv4_addresses:18.0.50.0\\/24"

Change-Id: I0d850a1576332b910698e2b5da327f792c1518ca
Partial-Bug: #1622781

[WIP] Add support for Tacker resources

Allow Searchlight to index Tacker's resource info (vnf, vnffg, ns, vim)
into ElasticSearch

Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>
Story: #2004968
Task: #29421

subject: [train][goal] Define new 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only' job
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-25 06:23:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only' will install searchlight.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35928

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I8ee0c999cb7563df0f6f102929dc25f36af623cc

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'searchlight-tempest-ipv6-only' will install searchlight.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35928

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I8ee0c999cb7563df0f6f102929dc25f36af623cc

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]

- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

Change-Id: I2a58e8d4c6f4331104474c216c99427db49f1cab

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2a58e8d4c6f4331104474c216c99427db49f1cab

subject: optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-03 06:53:10.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/docker/Dockerfile'], 'message': "optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Id13da51fe7aed3114e1f21f76c7620ae70a808a7
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Id13da51fe7aed3114e1f21f76c7620ae70a808a7
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Added apis to scenario manager

Tempest plugins do use associate_floating_ip() and
disassociate_floating_ip() api but scenario-
manager doesn't implement it.
The plugins using these apis are manila-tempest-
plugin, tap, vmware-nsx and neutron-tempest-plugin.
Hence, added it to the scenario manager

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I41792bdc3478f5f290a6b3b7172ef3f6b4c62c19

commit_message:
Move enable ksm on compute node to deploy step 1

When using RHSM Service (deployment/rhsm/rhsm-baremetal-ansible.yaml) based
registration of the overcloud nodes and enabling the KSM using
NovaComputeEnableKsm=True the overcloud deployment will fail because the
RHSM registration and the ksm task run as host_prep task. The handling
of enable/disable ksm is now handled in deploy step 1.

Closes-Bug: #1904184

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I75a59f3d4b640f3146f2a865eff8be3f1383e078
(cherry picked from commit c329204dece419afb3c1615b4f6ffef6581b50cd)

commit_message:
Added bunch of systemd_*_targets variables

We add several additional variables into the template, since they can't
be properly overriden with config_template, as there might be more then
single mention of each key for the single service.

Change-Id: Ie3e9a141eb074cfadf45533e98c47f93adde3287

commit_message:
Release os-brick for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for os-brick for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I74e86dc676b7c893fea20b8b2dd0c733f40019b8

commit_message:
Create Job to Publish Helm-addon Chart

In order to make this repository able
to cooperate with openstack-helm-deployments,
this repository must publish to a helm
chart repository for openstack-helm-
deployments to access

Change-Id: I6d8285d8e6c08fb70035d8bf0109c7f054397415

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-02 12:35:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not use pick() for dhcp_domain as it can be empty string

The puppet pick function returns the first value that is not undefined or an
empty string.
An empty string is a valid value for dhcp_domain so we cannot use pick() to
 choose between the current/deprecated param.

Closes-bug: #1905418

commit_message:
Allow both DEFAULT/dhcp_domain and api/dhcp_domain to be set

Partial revert of If6a26527a737a7184ebddd5b4bc346d64827e9e3 to allow
both/either config option to be used until it is clear what nova will
take.

Related-bug: #1903908
Change-Id: I98fe83e0c245388944529cd19b5e2bbed134e855

commit_message:
Revert "Don't use opendev docker proxy"

This reverts commit 42f3b3eaf5a8794b1f247915fffbef68137e6c1c.

Reason for revert: dockerhub now sets a hard limit on daily pulls, lets switch back to using the opendev docker proxy.

Change-Id: I87e399c89d5736f39d7bdba2011655e5f5766180

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 07:25:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Add qemu metadata to compute node when tls for live migration

With I7f583d18e558b95922a66eb539cc91de74409c96 certificates are
moved to use bind mounts and in case of UseTLSTransportForNbd
to create the required certificates even if UseTLSTransportForNbd
is set to False. In case of UseTLSTransportForNbd is False the
compute node still need the qemu metadata to have permissions
to request the certificates for the nbd tls use case.

Change-Id: Ibba61afbeb3957a955aa6d75e8258279a60fd141
(cherry picked from commit 83e6f9a6c5c6559134cbaeadab1b998bdfef86ad)
(cherry picked from commit dffc5fadf538e791767038960244793969aa0b97)
(cherry picked from commit 6cc86ee96ec9ec25dc6efa5862875ac19ed8e10a)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add qemu metadata to compute node when tls for live migration

With I7f583d18e558b95922a66eb539cc91de74409c96 certificates are
moved to use bind mounts and in case of UseTLSTransportForNbd
to create the required certificates even if UseTLSTransportForNbd
is set to False. In case of UseTLSTransportForNbd is False the
compute node still need the qemu metadata to have permissions
to request the certificates for the nbd tls use case.

Change-Id: Ibba61afbeb3957a955aa6d75e8258279a60fd141
(cherry picked from commit 83e6f9a6c5c6559134cbaeadab1b998bdfef86ad)
(cherry picked from commit dffc5fadf538e791767038960244793969aa0b97)
(cherry picked from commit 6cc86ee96ec9ec25dc6efa5862875ac19ed8e10a)

commit_message:
[Container build] raise Exception post logging error

Currently it catches SystemError and log error message
but do not fail, raise SystemError so it fails too.

Closes-Bug: #1905348
Change-Id: I2e823c58779dba529a58aff5e0e1c0c880c267aa
(cherry picked from commit 2c7f7d6e610b47a1ce205e23839f023877a1a774)
(cherry picked from commit 7331b280ae148473b9ce185c4ff75d5a3babfc58)

commit_message:
Add a debug tasks on  pull_success output

Allow the user to see the output of pull_success
which is used to repull containers if needed.

Also add loop_var to avoid 'item' output confusion.

Related-Bug: #1903882
Change-Id: Ic04607c5511597575888c28f8559a7d602fd8b0c
Signed-off-by: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update Rabbitmq exporter version

With current version of rabbitmq-exporter,
unable to retrieve data sometimes,
failing with rabbitmq timeout issues.
Rabbitmq timeout threshold is set as 10 sec
and is not configurable with current version.

Updating the rabbitmq-exporter version to
kbudde/rabbitmq-exporter:v1.0.0-RC7.1
(Default "RABBITMQ_TIMEOUT" set as 30 sec)
to solve rabbitmq timeout issues.

Change-Id: Ia51f368a1bba2b0fd9195cf9991b55864cdebfc1

commit_message:
Change registry for fetching coredns image.

We see a lot of issues regarding fetching images from docker.io, due to
their latest changes to the quota policy, so that we decided to move to
registry quay.io.

Change-Id: Ia91ad1c3384a35bb9c87c092e20862a188aa2fdf
(cherry picked from commit 42b5790064bb785d1bb5c79cf10f9507c364559d)

commit_message:
Replace Fedora test image with F32

Fedora 31 was retired and the image is gone from mirrors.
heat-cfntools have been dropped from fedora images, disable
the test till that's resolved.

Also makes grenade job non-voting, till this is backported
to stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Id869f83a46454897c2fe7a532eebfa2863befe5e
(cherry picked from commit 61e53c4eca3bc4f0c60754269cb2811afc569705)

commit_message:
Modify overcloud-deploy to support multiple stacks

To make overcloud-deploy role support deployment of multiple overcloud
stacks using a single undercloud node - we have generalized the vars
for stack name and removed hardcoding on "overcloud" name.

We also created a new playbook which install two overcloud stack -
overcloud and overcloud-two.

we also created j2 version of deploy and post-deploy script for
overcloud-two stack.

Intention is to create a new ci periodic job which test multi overcloud
stack deployment, The new ci job will not be executed upstream but 
rather in periodic only.

Change-Id: I353a0497cb4d44f82806381ee0a33b978c86be5f

subject: Fix handling of default_tag
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-30 14:47:23.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/image/test_image_uploader.py', 'container-images/container_image_prepare_defaults.yaml', 'tripleo_common/image/kolla_builder.py', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/image/test_kolla_builder.py'], 'message': 'Fix handling of default_tag

The previous fix, 589ac8ac0d5a14ce4aa831892d3b0a4a31e29674 was not fully
working as intended because during the templating of the container image
prepare entry, the setting for default_tag was being lost.

This fix simplifies the handling by just checking the initial
mapping_args for the presence of a tag key to determine if the
default_tag flag should be set.

Change-Id: Idfebf62e0e10b709367cfcb6977cf18550a4a4b0
Partial-Bug: #1886547
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b4275c7b40d4546e004b70f404cb6ae11f864544)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of default_tag

The previous fix, 589ac8ac0d5a14ce4aa831892d3b0a4a31e29674 was not fully
working as intended because during the templating of the container image
prepare entry, the setting for default_tag was being lost.

This fix simplifies the handling by just checking the initial
mapping_args for the presence of a tag key to determine if the
default_tag flag should be set.

Change-Id: Idfebf62e0e10b709367cfcb6977cf18550a4a4b0
Partial-Bug: #1886547
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b4275c7b40d4546e004b70f404cb6ae11f864544)

commit_message:
Revert "Rebase qcow2 images when unshelving an instance"

imagecache.get_cache_fname(base_image_ref) raises an AttributeError when
instance.system_metadata.get('image_base_image_ref') returns None.
This case(i.e image_base_image_ref not present in system_metadata) got hit
in TripleO job(#1893618). The issue happens after test_rebuild_server* are
executed which likely clears up 'image_base_image_ref'.

Related-Bug: #1732428
Closes-Bug: #1893618
This reverts commit 8953a689467f8c3e996086392251de67953a45ba.

Change-Id: I6800d6de1d8d903bd2b6aebf5e138d9277973148

commit_message:
Fix dynamic actions further

* Reworked /code_sources and /dynamic_actions API endpoints to
  simplify them. For now they don't work with multiple objects and
  they are consistent with other endpoints. If needed, we'll add
  support for multiple objects (i.e. adding multiple dynamic actions
  with a single request) later in a backwards compatible manner.
* Simplified unit tests.
* Got rid of services/*.py modules since they didn't do anything
  useful. They were just wrappers around DB API calls.

Change-Id: Ib5a53f1f1a185f0395ffae1ab0c401633fcdd0fc

commit_message:
[Container build] raise Exception post logging error

Currently it catches SystemError and log error message
but do not fail, raise SystemError so it fails too.

Closes-Bug: #1905348
Change-Id: I2e823c58779dba529a58aff5e0e1c0c880c267aa
(cherry picked from commit 2c7f7d6e610b47a1ce205e23839f023877a1a774)

[{'created': '2020-12-07 04:37:44.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/functional/cli/v2/test_cli_v2.py'], 'message': "Fix functional action CLI test

* After the action provider refactoring one CLI test in the client
  fails because, in fact, there was a non-backwards compatible
  change made during the refactoring: we can't use IDs of actions
  to find them anymore. It was a trade-off that we had to agree on
  in order to implement action providers. So the failing tests
  has now been rewritten to work with name istead of ID.

Change-Id: Ic58b7bb5ec6a38df2c2e538f16b24be48e286e8c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix functional action CLI test

* After the action provider refactoring one CLI test in the client
  fails because, in fact, there was a non-backwards compatible
  change made during the refactoring: we can't use IDs of actions
  to find them anymore. It was a trade-off that we had to agree on
  in order to implement action providers. So the failing tests
  has now been rewritten to work with name istead of ID.

Change-Id: Ic58b7bb5ec6a38df2c2e538f16b24be48e286e8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 01:37:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new optimal assert checks in tacker unit test

This patch changes old assert checks in tacker unit test cases to new
optimal assert checks provided by hacking plugin in release 4.0.0.
Please refer [1] for optimal assert checks details.

The patch modifies following,
 * Changes assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) to assertIsInstance(A, B).
 * Changes assertEqual(type(A), B) to assertIsInstance(A, B).
 * Changes assertTrue(A not in B, message) to the more specific
   assertNotIn(A, B, message).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-4-0-0

Change-Id: Iee059c00df1be212ae69fbc77cb783748da206b1
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-12-04 09:50:37.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/objects/test_vnf_instantiated_info.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/objects/test_terminate_vnf_request.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tacker/tests/unit/api/test_api_common.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/vnflcm/test_controller.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/db/test_vnf_package.py', 'tacker/vnfm/nfvo_client.py', 'tacker/tests/functional/vnfm/test_tosca_vnf.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/vnfm/infra_drivers/kubernetes/test_translate_outputs.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/api/v1/test_attributes.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/common/test_csar_utils.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/objects/test_vim_connection.py'], 'message': 'Move tacker to new hacking 4.0.0

commit_message:
Move tacker to new hacking 4.0.0

Hacking 4.0.0 has introduce new optimal assert checks.
Please refer [1] for more details.

Additionally Hacking has enabled some new checks by default,
and the next update to the new release will introduce failures
in tacker pep8 jobs.
The main impact is from I122d250cab90964c346e9d53046a97c25054bc00.

This patch addresses following -

* Adopt new optimal assert checks.
 * [H211] Change assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) to assertIsInstance(A, B).
 * [H212] Change assertEqual(type(A), B) to assertIsInstance(A, B).
 * [H214] Change assertTrue(A not in B, message) to the more specific
   assertNotIn(A, B, message)

* On bumping up the hacking version, below mention pep8 jobs failed.
  This patch address these issues now, when the new hacking release
  starts being used it will not cause a disruption.

    ./tacker/tests/unit/vnflcm/test_controller.py:343:33:
     F522 '...'.format(...) has unused named argument(s): expected_type
            expected_message = ("Invalid input for field/attribute "
                                ^
    ./tacker/tests/unit/common/test_csar_utils.py:194:16:
    F504 '...' % ... has unused named argument(s): csar
        msg = (('The filename "%(manifest)s" is an invalid name.'
               ^
    ./tacker/vnfm/nfvo_client.py:191:21:

commit_message:
Map build host repos to distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d

Currently, when building container images, we are overriding the ubi
image repos with the repos configured in the host. Effectively, this is
removing ubi repo config from the image build environment which most of
the times is not a problem as centos is on sync with ubi, but in some
cases as after RHEL 8.3 release, ubi is ahead of CentOS and need
packages from the ubi repo itself.

This patch is bind mounting the repos config from build host in
distro.repos.d instead of yum.repos.d. In that way, both the repos
configured by default in the image (ubi repos) and the ones in the host
are available.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761702
Change-Id: I08d44d9811bd2666f6732c0541bbdd4a0345d265
Closes-Bug: #1902846

commit_message:
Adding Ceph Dashboard to the Edge roles

This change adds the CephGrafana Service for the
Edge roles.
Also, a new DistributedComputeHCIDashboard is
introduced: the purpose of this role is to support
the StorageDashboard network on the edge site when
that network is defined and used in central site.

Change-Id: I973e1364e5f3d0e03658acdd37e316a59504825e
(cherry picked from commit 0b41751786e8c170afa73ec17853dc4a77f0b38d)

commit_message:
Move updating access test case to a separate test class

Updating access will change the instance public address, which affects other
test cases in the same test class.

Enable more tests in this patch.

Added some test cases which always failed in CI in tempest blacklist file.

Story: 2008410
Task: 41351

Change-Id: I09b4f00da941b7ead5a93c4c41b196cbe9934bbe

commit_message:
Test patching booleans with string values

The baremetal client encodes boolean patch values as strings
("True", "False") but there is no unit test coverage which confirms
that this actually works. This change adds that test coverage.

Change-Id: I9e428ad973e88d3e1ef1e04e49a7b00a4e2d43fd

object fields.

commit_message:
Remove the registry_ip_address variable from content providers

We should never use registry_ip_address var instead relying on
registry_ip_address_branch to avoid related-bug.

This removes registry_ip_address from returned zuul data and
updates the last few references to it.

For the install-built-repo pre-run play we can't rely on
release to determine the right ip_address_branch. This re-uses
logic from the build-containers role after moving it to its own
tasks file to prevent duplication.

Change-Id: Id594d301d18bc33753e56ef3b7519e36a396cd82
Related-Bug: 1904565
